availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. J. Lee (Bath County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Maria M. Lee. Father of Sarah Lee, Amelia Lee, John C. Lee, Emily F. Lee, Mary N. Lee, Alexander C. Lee, Lettie Lee and Jim Lee. Merchant in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Bath County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 1A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 296.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 74A.
Find A Grave, "James A. J. Lee (1815- 26 Mar 1893)," Memorial #80586018, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80586018 (accessed July 9, 2020).
